intro: Brachyachne ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous shortgrass, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers are small and wind-pollinated. Brachyachne ambigua plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and distribution.
